photo.title: Fort Stanwix

photo.description: At Fort Stanwix National Monument, the park rangers were digging test holes to see if there was anything of archealogical significance in the central parade area, in case there was anything in the way of where a new sprinkler system would go. They'd dug below the 1980s restoration and found nothing. There's plenty of room for the sprinkler system!
photo.tags: work park ranger nationalparkservice monument fortstanwix rome newyork
photo.title: Friendly park ranger

photo.description: At Fort Stanwix National Monument, there were extra park rangers on hand to dig pilot holes to see if there was anything of archaeological significance where a sprinkler system was planned to be installed. They weren't finding anything, despite having gone down pretty deep. She answered my questions about when the re-creation of the fort had been done, and about the digging. I was more interested in the creation of public history, than in the history of the fort, I'm afraid.
photo.tags: work park ranger nationalparkservice fortstanwix monument rome newyork women
photo.title: Friendly park ranger

photo.description: Fort Stanwix National Monument, Rome, NY

photo.title: Stanwix

photo.title: Ramparts

photo.description: Near the Fort Stanwix national monument, we saw a park ranger heading off on his bike, probably to another landmark along the Erie Canal (though that's not what Fort Stanwix was about).
photo.tags: bike park ranger nationalparkservice rome newyork
